revised_title: An Account of Malignant Fevers in Rouen: Epidemiology and Medical Observations
tldr: The author, Monsieur Le Cat, provides a detailed account of the malignant fevers that raged in Rouen from 1753 to 1754. He discusses the symptoms, treatment, and medical observations of these diseases, including the role of infection and the impact on the population. The text offers valuable insights into the medical practices and understanding of infectious diseases during this period.
